Two people were captured including a policeman and a civilian and then executed by Islamic State militants in a village in the southern Kirkuk Province.[176]
At least 400 rockets and mortar shells were fired from Gaza Strip to southern Israel killing one man and injuring dozens. The terrorist group Hamas claimed the attacks.[177]
A Vehicle-borne improvised explosive device wounded six civilians on a bus in Al-Zahra district of Homs.[178]

An explosive device detonate in the substation of Power Plants in the municipality of Aguachica, south of Cesar Department, Colombia. The attack left 38,000 inhabitants without electricity between the south of Cesar and Bolívar.[179]

A magnetic bomb attached to a vehicle in Afghanistan's Nangarhar province detonated injuring at least 11 people including shopkeepers. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack yet but the Islamic State is suspected as they have done similar attacks in the past month in this area.[180]
A tribal elder was assassinated by multiple unidentified armed men in Herat's Injil District.[181]

n Mwa, Donga-Mantung, the town's mayor was killed by unidentified gunmen. In Buea, a teacher at a government high school was kidnapped by three armed men, who also beat up another teacher and some students. The teacher was released by his captors on November 21[182][183]

A Taliban attack killed at least 12 security officers that were guarding the Kamal Khan Dam in Chahar Burjak district of southwestern Nimroz province. A Taliban insurgent was also killed in the clash.[184]
Boko Haram attacks on Farmers in villages of the Borno State left at least 16 farmers dead and at least 35 missing.[185][186]
An armed attack by the PKK on Turkey's Cucurka left 3 road construction workers injured.[187]
The Taliban attacked security posts in the Urozgan Province killing at least 10 security officers and injuring around 5. 15 Taliban terrorists were also killed in the attack.[188]
A bomb placed by Maoists detonated injuring five security personnel and one civilian in India's Chhattisgarh's district.[189][190]

A policeman killed three of his colleagues and wounded a fourth one in a shooting attack in the city of Pol-e Alam. The policeman is said to have contacts with the Taliban and to have done the attack for the Taliban.[191]

An improvised device detonated prematurely and seriously injured a female militant in an attack against the grave of Ramón Lorenzo Falcón[192] In another incident an explosive device were threw to the house of the judge Claudio Bonaro, in Belgrano neighborhood, but failed to detonate. The attacks occurred two weeks after the G-20 summit that will take place in the Argentine capital. A series of raids were carried out leaving more than 13 detainees.[193][194]
A Taliban attack on the Maidan Wardak Province killed at least 9 Afghan Soldiers, 5 Taliban were also killed in the clashes.[195]
A group of eight gunmen attacked a man  the legs in a paramilitary attack in Ballymagroarty area at Gogarty Close, Derry, after the 8 pm.[196]
Two soldiers were killed and another one was injured in an attack by an Al-Qaeda group on a checkpoint in the Segou Region.[197][198]

Boko Haram terrorists believed to be affiliated with the Islamic State West Africa Province attacked a military base in the small town of Kareto at the Borno State leaving 3 soldiers dead and several others wounded and missing.[199]

Eight Ansar-al-Sunna militants attacked the Nagalue village in the Macomia District shooting dead a person and wounding another one. Afterwards the militants set on fire at least 19 houses before leaving.[200]
Four Israeli Soldiers were lightly injured when an assailant stabbed them in a police station in the neighborhood of Jerusalem, Armon Hanatziv. The attacker was shot and wounded.[201][202]

A school was burned by gunmen fired some shots before setting the building on fire in the municipality of Ercilla. Later, two houses located in the rural area of Angol were set on fire by unknown attackers, barricades were also reported in nearby localities.[203]
The Taliban surprise attacked an army base in the Farah province killing at least 40 security personnel and wounding several as well as seizing many weapons and vehicles from the base.[204][205][206]
13 nuns were kidnapped by unidentified gunmen in Bamessing, spending a day in captivity before being released the next day.[207]
Boko Haram gunmen torched houses, mostly built of thatch roofs and walls in  Mammanti, a community located just outside Maiduguri, leaving one civilian killed. The attackers fleed in bikes.[208]
Naxals killed a road construction contractor. Three workers were beaten and torched vehicles on Thursday, in Chhattisgarh's insurgency-hit Sukma district, police said.[209][210]
A bomb detonated while a police vehicle was on its way from Mosul to a nearby village leaving 2 civilians dead and a policeman injured. The Islamic State was most likely behind the attack.[211]

At least thirteen somali civilians were killed and other twenty were injuried when Oromo militants attacked the market town of Moyale,Somali Region. The ONLF condemned the attack saying that oromo militias could be behind the attack.[212]
A bomb exploded while a civilian was passing by ultimately killing the civilian. The bombing occurred in the Bara Subdivision.[213]
3 security forces were killed and 2 were wounded in Taliban attacks in the Qala I Zal District. 13 Taliban militants were killed and 16 were wounded.[214]

Location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: 20 people including 8 UN Peacekeepers and 12 Congo Soldiers were killed as well as 10 others injured in an attack by the Allied Democratic Forces during a military operation by the UN Soldiers near Beni.[215][216][217]
Terrorists of suspected Hizbul Mujahideen abducted a 17-year-old teenager and later shot him dead in a village in Pulwama, India.[218]
A municipal councilor of the village of Bossey in the Province of Arbinda was shot dead by several presumed Ansarul Islam gunmen.[219]

Attacks by armed groups killed at least 60 civilians in the town of Alindao. The attacks began when Anti-Balaka fighters attacked Muslims, afterwards a Seleka group killed dozens of Christians in an attack on a cathedral and many of the people killed were sheltering at a church while also setting many homes on fire one person was left missing and dozens were injured. In total 60 people were killed in the attacks.[220][221][222][223]

Location: La Araucania Region and Bio-Bio Region
Details: A school,and a Catholic church were burned in Ercilla, barricades have been registered that keep traffic interrupted in the area of Traiguén towards Victoria and Los Sauces, and between the communes of Imperial and Carahue, in the Araucanía region. Other minor attacks in Angol, Collipulli and Temuco, this attacks were motivated in response of the murder of Camilo Catrillanca, who was shot dead for members of the "Comando Jungla, the special forces of the Carabineros de Chile [224][225][226]
Jihadist rebels operating in Idlib led by the Al-Qaeda linked group Hurras-al-Deen killed at least 22 Syrian regime fighters in the northwest part of the Hama Governorate.[227][228]

Four construction machinerys were burned in near the principal highway of Villa Mascardi, Rio Negro Province.The submitted and they entered a manuscript pamphlet related with the mapuche conflict in his pocket[229]
The Islamic State executed 2 women suspected of dealing with the Syrian Democratic Forces. The execution occurred in the Al-Shaafah town.[230]

Location: Oicha, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: ADF rebels attacked a village in DRC's Oicha with machetes killing 4 civilians and wounding several as well as burning and looting more than 17 houses and shops.[231][232]

A landmine explosion while civilians were harvesting olives in a farm near Azaz killed one person and injured three others. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack but militants are suspected.[233]
An explosive device near the Quaidabad flyover in Karachi detonated killing two civilians and injuring eight. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing.[234][235]

Boko Haram fighters attacked an army base at the town of Kekeno killing a soldier and injuring four others. The Boko Haram fighters tried to take over the army base; the army managed to repel the attack.[236][237]
New People's Army gunmen ambushed a patrol injuring six police officers in Libmanan town, Camarines Sur, Philippines.[238]

5 Phillipinean soldiers were killed and 23 others were wounded when they were trying to rescue hostages being held by the Abu Sayyaf in Jolo Sulu. The Abu Sayyaf terrorists opened fire on them, killing 5 and injuring 23.[239]

A former senior police officer was gunned down while walking towards his home by multiple assailants in Quetta. This former senior police officer had also survived other numerous attacks. The Tehrik-i-Taliban later claimed responsibility.[240]
Mortars launched by the Taliban struck a wedding in Maidan Wardak's Jalrez District, killing 2 civilians and wounding 13.[241]
A civilian was shoot multiple times in a paramilitary style attack in Derry, Northen Ireland.[242]
A woman blew herself up near the entrance of a police checkpoint in Grozny when she was asked to stop and show her documents. No one else was killed or injured in the blast.[243][244]
Terrorists kidnapped three people in the Shopian District and then shot one dead in suspicion of being informers for security forces.[245][246]
Militants shelled several areas of the Latakia Governorate, killing 18 Syrian Soldiers and wounding another one.[247][248]

3 security forces were killed and 3 others wounded in an attack by the Taliban on a military checkpoint in Kunduz's Khan Abad District. 7 Taliban were also killed and 5 others wounded in the clashes.[249]

A roadside bomb detonation killed a district chief and intelligence director in the Baraki Barak district as they were heading towards their office. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[250][251]
The Taliban attacked a police checkpoint in Afghanistan's Qadis District killing 5 guards and wounding 3. The Taliban also captured another guard.[252]

Armed men on bikes presumed to be from the Islamic State attacked a gendarmerie station in Niger's Makalondi killing 2 gendarmes and a worker and injuring another gendarme, while leaving another one missing.[253][254]
Two soldiers were killed and two others were wounded when militants attacked their vehicle with rockets in the North Waziristan region. Tehrik-i-Taliban later claimed responsibility.[255][256]
A roadside bomb detonated targeting a vehicle carrying AMISOM soldiers in Mogadishu killing 2 Ugandan soldiers and wounding another three. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility.[257]
Seven Ugandan fishermen were killed and another one wounded in a Mai-Mai militia attack on the Hoima District. The militiamen had crossed over from the Congo to attack the fishermen.[258]
A soldier was killed and two others were wounded when militants opened fire on them while they were paroling an area in the Ladha Subdivision.[259]

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a policeman in Kumba, releasing him the day after for a ransom. In other incident a policeman was kidnapped and beheaded by unidentified gunmen, despite receiving ransom from the family. The policeman had been accused of training Ambazonian fighters, and was on the way to Yaoundé to defend himself when he was kidnapped.[260][261]

A congregation was attacked in India's Rajasansi when multiple masked men hurled a grenade into the crowd killing 3 people and injuring 20 others. The attack was being investigated as an act of terror and the attack also took place amid a high alert that the Jaish-e-Mohammed had entered the area nearby and were planning to move towards Delhi.[262][263]
Jaish-e-Mohammed attacked a military camp in the Pulwama District and opened fire killing a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) trooper.[264][265]
A bomb blast killed three paramilitary soldiers and wounded four others on the outskirts of the city of Quetta, Hizbul Ahrar later claimed responsibility for the bombing.[266][267]
A car bomb detonated in the city of Tikrit killing 5 civilians and injuring 16 others. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[268][269][270]

Two people were killed and two others were wounded when a bomb exploded near a luxury vehicle that a soldier was driving in the Wedio Area near Mogadishu. The soldier was killed and a passerby civilian was killed by the blast.[271]

Boko Haram fighters loyal to ISIL attacked a military base in the Nigerian town of Metele, killing at least 118 soldiers while at least 153 others were still missing as of today. The militants also seized tanks, armored vehicles, weapons, and ammunition.[272][273][274][275]

A clash occurred between terrorists and soldiers in the Algerian Province of Constantine, one soldier was killed and another two were wounded and one of the terrorists was also killed, while a search operation by the military is underway.[276][277]
5 people were killed and 7 others were injured when a gun battle broke out near the town of Guriceel between Somali Soldiers and Al-Shabaab. Most of the dead were civilians.[278]
A soldier was slightly injured when suspected Moro militants detonated an explosive device on a road at Datu Hoffer.[279]
A civilian was killed when a land mine placed by the Islamic State detonated in a Raqqa city Neighborhood.[280]
About 50 loggers were kidnapped after being rounded up by the Boko Haram. The mass kidnapping occurred close to the market town of Gamboru.[281]

Three Iraqi fishermen were killed by Islamic State militants in the city of Tuz Khurmatu. The fishermen were ambushed while they were fishing and later killed, while there bodies were discovered a few days later.[282]

Location: Oicha, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: Three people died when suspected ADF rebels fired a rocket at a Jeep Land Cruiser in a village at Oicha. The rocket explosion caused a fire in which 3 motorcycles were also burnt, several people were missing and injured.[283]
The Islamic State attacked a military checkpoint in Iraq's Makhmur town leaving two Iraqi Policemen dead.[284]

Al-Shabaab militants struck the camp beloging to the Rural Border Patrol Unit, shortly after 11pm and proceeded to open fire. The officers repulse the attack killing one and injuring an unknown number of militants.[285]
Members of the Paraguayan People's Army kidnapped a Brazilian farmer then shot him dead in the San Pedro Department.[286][287]
An attack by Islamic State gunmen on a SDF checkpoint in the Deir ez-Zor suburbs left four dead and several others wounded.[288]

A bomb and shooting attack on a police patrol killed an officer and wounded four others in the area of the Khanaqin, no group claimed responsibility but the Islamic State was most likely behind the blast.[289][290][291]

Nine farmers were killed and an additional three were injured, when Boko Haram terrorists opened fire on the farmers as they were working in the Borno State. Boko Haram also kidnapped and abducted 12 farmers.[292][293]
Militants shelled several areas of the Aleppo Province killing two Syrian Soldiers and wounding seven more.[294]
A shootout between security forces and terrorists in the Shopian District left an officer dead and two wounded. Two terrorists were also killed in the encounter.[295]

Unidentified gunmen kidnapped nine students and a teacher from Lords Bilingual Secondary school in Kumba. The army went on a search, and was able to locate the kidnappers' camp. At night the camp was raided, resulting in the death of two kidnappers and the capture of one, while three students were rescued. The remaining seven hostages were able to escape on their own, while the army pursued the remaining kidnappers into the bushes. Two more kidnappers, including the leader, were killed the next morning.[296]
A Somali police officer and his bodyguard were shot dead outside a hotel in Mogadishu by Al-Shabaab gunmen.[297]

November 2018 Kabul attack: A suicide bomber detonated his or her explosives inside a wedding hall in Kabul where hundreds of scholars and clerics had gathered to mark the birthday of Islam's Prophet Muhammad. The suicide bombing killed at least 55 people and injured 94, no group has claimed responsibility yet for the blast, but the Islamic State is suspected, while the Taliban denied any involvement in the attack.[298][299][300][301][302]
A grenade attack by militants on a police camp in the Samba District left an officer dead and three wounded.[303]
An IED followed by gunfire struck a military vehicle in the Mopti region, killing two occupants and injuring six.[304]
A bomb attack by the Taliban in Kandahar's Shah Wali Kot District left three policemen dead and two others wounded.[305]
A person was beheaded by Ansar al Sunna insurgents in an attack on a village in the Macomia District, Mozambique.[306]

2018 Brussels stabbing attack: A lone wolf terrorist attacked police officers outside a police station. One police officer was wounded and the attacker was shot and injured. The police suspects Islamic terrorism.[307]
In Belo, the Vice Principal of the Government Bilingual High School was killed in his own home by unidentified gunmen.[308]
Two soldiers were injured when assailants threw an improvised explosive device against the security forces.[309]
A roadside bomb struck a vehicle in the Bajaur District resulting in the deaths of two people. The vehicle was also completely destroyed and the Tehrik-i-Taliban claimed responsibility.[310][311]
Suspects member of the FARC 33th Fron threw grenades and injured four officers in the municipality of Tibu, Norte de Santander Department.[312]
A bomb exploded inside a mosque in the Pakistani city of Chaman. The bomb blast injured at least 10 people and no group has claimed responsibility yet for the bombing.[313][314]

Location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: Militants belonging to the Allied Democratic Forces fired a MONUSCO,  The attack came in the eastern region of Beni, where last week eight UN peacekeepers died in a clash with ADF.[315]
Al-Shabaab attacked a police station in the town of Beled Hawo leaving three people dead, according to security forces the attack was managed to be repulsed.[316]
Militants detonate an improvised explosive device a in the Cañaguata sector, part of the Caño Limón–Coveñas pipeline. No oil spills were reported in the area.[317][318]
The Taliban ambushed a military convoy carrying soldiers in Qala-e-Naw, killing 4 soldiers and injuring 7 others.[319][320]
A homemade bomb detonate near a team of rangers removed banners hanging on a road to demand independence for so-called Patani state. No one was injured in the incident[321]
Presumed Boko Haram militants killed 8 people and injured 5 others in an attack on a French drilling company site in the Diffa Department.[322][323][324]

A roadside bomb detonated near a bus in a town near Mosul killing four schoolchildren and injuring seven others. No group claimed responsibility but the attack was blamed on the Islamic State.[325][326]
Suspected militants of Ulfa-i attacked with a grenades a shop in the Sivasagar district killing a person and injuring three others.[327]

A shootout between the Abu Sayyaf and security forces  left a child and woman dead as well as three minors injured. An Abu Sayyaf fighter was also killed in the shootout which happened in the Zamboanga Area.[328][329]
Two paramilitary soldiers were killed and four others wounded when their vehicle ran over a landmine near the Badush Dam. The landmine had been left by the Islamic State.[330]
Presumed Ansar-al-Sunna attacked a village in the Nangade district using machetes killing 12 villagers the insurgents afterwards set on fire and burnt at least 40 homes.[331]
Two civilian defense volunteers were gunned down by multiple insurgents at a market in Pattani's Kapho District.[332]
An Islamic State attack on Syrian Soldier positions in the Tadmur area of Homs left at least 10 Syrian Soldiers killed.[333]

2018 Karachi Chinese consulate attack: Four people were killed in an armed assault on the Chinese consulate in Karachi, Pakistan.[334][335][336] Three attackers were also killed by security forces.[337] The attack was claimed by the Balochistan Liberation Army.[338]

A guard who worked at the palace of the governor of the northern province of Niassa was gunned down in Friday night at the Marrupa District by multiple armed gunmen believed to be from the Ansar-al-Sunna group.[339]

2018 Orakzai bombing: A suicide bomber detonation in a market killed 34 people and wounded around 56 people at a market in the Shi'ite dominated region of Kalaya, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, northern Pakistan. The Islamic State claimed responsibility.[340][341][342][343][344][345]

A suicide bombing left 27 Afghan National Army personnel dead and another 57 wounded in a mosque at an army base in the Khost Province, Afghanistan. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[346][347][348][349]
Three forestal machinery and a container were burned during an arson attack in El Descabezado sector, Arauco Province.The Coordinadora Arauco Malleco claimed responsibility for the attack.[350]

Militants attacked a military checkpoint with machine guns and rocket launchers in the Mudiyah District. The attackers killed five Emirati soldiers and injured an additional one. No group claimed responsibility but the attack was blamed on Al-Qaeda In the Arabian Peninsula.[351]

An improvised explosive device blast against a bank in the capital of Cordoba that caused the fire of an ATM, in the site of the attack graffiti related with mapuche activist killed were found. The prosecutor Rubén Caro and the Antiterrorist Intelligence Division of the Córdoba police investigate the attack, in addition to that began anti-anarchist raidsraids in the city.[352][353][354]
Four people were injured in the Dera Bugti District when their passenger vehicle struck a roadside bomb, no group has claimed responsibility for the blast.[355][356]
Multiple armed gunmen believed to be ISIS attacked a police station in the town of Tazirbu, killing 9 police officers as well as kidnapping 11 locals and police officers.[357][358]

Location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: ADF gunmen on motorcycles shot a civilian dead and injured another one in an attack on the village of Boikene close to the city of Beni.[359]
2 Colombian soldiers were killed and 2 were wounded when an explosive device exploded as they were guarding a pipeline in the municipality of El Tarra. The attack was blamed on the ELN.[360][361]

The Islamic State attacked positions of the Syrian Democratic Forces in the Deirezzor Governorate, killing 92 SDF soldiers, and injuring an unknown amount of others. 61 Islamic State fighters were also killed in the attacks, while 51 civilians died but due to airstrikes.[362][363][364][365]
A Catholic priest, a deacon and their driver were kidnapped in Munyenge, Muyuka, sub division of the South West region of Cameroon.[366]
A bomb and shooting attack by Al-Shabaab on an armored vehicle carrying soldiers in the town of Balad as they were heading to Mogadishu, killed 10 soldiers and injured several others.[367]
15 girls were kidnapped by 50 Boko Haram gunmen in a village close to the town of Toumour, Niger.[368][369]
A bomb blast in Badush Town killed 2 policemen and injured another one. The bomb exploded as the policemen were patrolling.[370]
An explosive device left by the Islamic State, detonated killing 5 children in the Tal al Hawa town of Northern parts of the Aleppo Province.[371]
Militants shelled several parts of Aleppo with projectiles containing possible chlorine gas, at least 100 people suffered suffocation problems in the attack.[372][373]
Militants shoot against an abandoned retreat of the ranch Las Margaritas, some of the bullets impacted to a water tank. There is also talk of pamphlets belonging to the EPP.[374][375]

Eight rebels and two policemen were killed during a gunfight who took place in at a forest in Kistaram area bordering Telangana, around 500 km from here, when a team of security personnel was out on an anti-Naxal operation, Sukma's Superintendent of Police Abhishek Meena said.[376][377]
Three people were injured in a bomb attack on a coffee shop in Somalia's Baidoa, Al-Shabaab is suspected for the attack.[378]

A militant belonging to ELN´s Ernesto Che Guevara Front was killed and five marines were injured after a gunfight in the municipality of Bajo Baudó, Chocó, according to the army's report. In addition, a homemade grenade launcher, a shotgun and explosives were seized.[379]
Three members of the SDF in Manbij died when an explosive device planted by Islamic State militants exploded.[380]
An arson attack against a farm were reported in Collipulli, Chile. The attack destroyed forestry machinery and a barn.[381]
The Taliban stormed a security checkpoint in the Qaisar district of the northern Faryab province, killing 10 personnel and injuring 3 others. The Taliban ran off after the attack.[382]

Presumed insurgents gunned down two defense volunteers and an assistant village head in a market in Thailand's Songkhla Province. The insurgents also took two M16 assault rifles and a pistol belonging to the victims and fled.[383][384]
The Taliban ambushed a police convoy and opened fire in the Farah Province, killing 22 police officers and wounding 2 others.[385][386]

A suicide car bomber detonated at the gate of a religious center in Galkayo ran by a controversial cleric killing 17 people (including the cleric). Afterwards four gunmen stormed the building and began an exchange of fire killing 3 officers and resulting in 3 militants dead and one arrested, in total 20 people were killed and 20 were injured. The attack was claimed by Al-Shabaab; it is said that the cleric was killed for having music in religious ceremonies.[387][388]
A car bomb blast targeting a crowded marketplace in Mogadishu killed 8 people and injured 15 others, the attack was blamed on Al-Shabaab.[389]

Location: North Kivu, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: Two civilians on a motorbike were ambushed and killed by presumed members of the Allied Democratic Forces. The attack took place at the Mbau village in the North Kivu Province.[390]
Twelve people have been killed in a suspected Islamist militant attack in northern Mozambique, with thousands of villagers fleeing into neighbouring Tanzania, police sources said.[391][392]

Location: Oicha, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: 8 civilians were killed in an attack in a neighborhood in Ocha by the Allied Democratic Forces group. The attackers also burned more than five houses and looted two others.[393][394]
Boko Haram jihadists hacked 4 farmers to death and left another farmer with serious injuries in an attack in Jiddari-Polo, Borno State, Nigeria.[395]
A Palestinian rammed his vehicle against a group of Israeli Soldiers in the Karmei Tzur area. Three soldiers were injured in the attack and the attacker was shot dead.[396][397]
The officer of the Army’s 303rd Infantry Brigade Colonel Benedict Arevalowas injured when NPA militants attacked a CAFGU detachment in Barangay Asia, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental.[398]

Armed gunmen attacked a village in the Macomia District firing shots and attacking villagers with machetes killing a person and seriously leaving another one injured. The gunmen also set on fire and burned 14 stalls. The Ansar-al-Sunna group is believed to be behind this.[399]
Boko Haram jihadists of the Islamic State attacked a military base killing 3 soldiers. The attack on the base happened at the Cross Kauwa village.[400]
A roadside bomb detonated near a vehicle killing 4 U.S. service Members and wounding 3 other people including a US civilian contractor. The bombing occurred in Ghazni.[401][402][403]
A bomb hidden inside a vehicle went off, killing a civilian and injuring two others in Central Baghdad.[404]
Students and a staff member of the University of Bamenda were kidnapped on matriculation day. Government forces and separatists clashed in Bambili.[405]
A bomb placed by Al-Shabaab killed a soldier from Djibouti and injured another soldier. Two terrorists also died when a device they were planting at the Buloburde airport exploded prematurely.[406]

A suicide car bomber detonated targeting a British security contractor's compound in the Afghan capital Kabul, several gunmen then attacked the G4S compound right after the car bomb, in total 10 people died and 19 others were injured, the Taliban also claimed responsibility.[407][408][409]
A bomb blast killed an Iraqi civilian and left two others wounded in the Baqubah District. In the same area nearby an Islamic State sniper shot dead an Iraqi soldier.[410][411]

29 people were injured when a female suicide bomber detonated her explosives in a market at the town of Amchide. A second bomber was shot dead by security forces. The suicide bombers are believed to be from the Boko Haram group.[412][413]

At least 30 people were kidnapped by ten unidentified gunmen in Bangourain, Noun Division, West Region, close to the border with Northwest Region. The captives were transported with canoes across the Lake Bamendjing reservoir. In Kembong, just south of Mamfe, a military vehicle hit a road bomb; no soldiers died, but the vehicle was destroyed.[414][415]

A Pro-government tribal elder and a guard were killed when their vehicle struck a roadside bomb as they were returning from a mosque in the Bajaur District, no group has claimed responsibility as of yet.[416][417]
Gunmen on motorcycles opened fire on a security patrol in the Kasserine province resulting in a civilian bystander injured. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[418][419]

A civilian was killed and other injuried when a group of jihadis attacked the village of Nacotuco, in Macomia district, in the northern Mozambican province of Cabo Delgado. Acording to the sources the assailants burned a motorbike and a pick-up truck.[420][421]
A sticky bomb placed inside a car detonated in the Afghan city of Jalalabad, no casualties were reported in the attack.[422]

At least 15 policemen and civilians were killed in an attack in East Wollega zone and areas adjacent to Benishangul Regional State, Fana Broadcasting Corporate. This incident adds to the wave of attacks that have been registered in the area.[423][424]

A commander of the Pro-Mobilization Forces was killed and four of his aides were injured in a bomb blast while they were patrolling in the Hamrin Mountains. The attack was blamed on the Islamic State.[425][426]
Boko Haram militants affiliated with the Islamic State attacked a military base close to the town of Baga. The Boko Haram terrorists killed a soldier and injured seven others.[427]
A Herat intelligence chief was killed in a Taliban ambush attack in Herat's Shindand District.[428]

A military vehicle struck an IED while traveling in the Baye area, after the bomb blast it was followed by gunfire as a result of the attack. Two people died and several others were injured.[429][430]
Four policemen and a civilian driver were killed near Boungou when their vehicle struck a roadside bomb and was also hit by gunfire.[431]
Several gunmen opened fire on workers on a millet field killing 5 of them and wounding 2 others in the town of Abarakabougou.[432]

A customs officer was killed when multiple assailants opened fire on a police station in Tera, Niger. After the shooting the assailants escaped to the wild. The attack came after the area had been placed in a state of emergency due to attacks.[433]
The Taliban attacked security checkpoints in the Faryab Province causing clashes in which seven security forces died and eleven were wounded. Eleven Taliban insurgents were also killed.[1]
At least 14 road constructions vehicles were burned down by Maoists while ten drivers were kept hostage until the sunrise in the district of Gadchiroli, Maharashtra state.[2]
Boko Haram launched an attack on a military base in Buni Gari at Gujba, killing eight soldiers, while several were wounded in the attack. Six militants were also killed.[3][4][5][6]

An improvised explosive device were defused at the headquarters of the XV legislature of Quintana Roo. Days later an anarchist cell so-called "Celulas de ataque contra la devastacion de la tierra" claimed responsibility for the incident.[7][8]
Perpetrator: Celulas de Ataque contra la Devastacion de la Tierra

Details: Islamic State gunmen attacked and opened fire in the Nasr village. The attack killed a civilian and wounded the two others.[9]
Four trucks beloging to a local timber company were burned for mapuche gunmen in the municipality of Collipulli, in Malleco Province. At least one driver were hit in the incident.[10]
A Pakistani Shia coalmine worker was shot dead while another person was injured by Lashkar-e-Jhangvi terrorists in the Machh town of Pakistan.[11]
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonated their vests targeting a security patrol in Maiduguri, injuring five CJTF volunteers.[12][13]
At least four soldiers and a civilian were killed in  in a roadside bomb and gun attack in the East Region town of Bangou, Burkina Faso.[14]

Two attacks carried out by Ansar-al-Sunna terrorists left four people dead in two days: the first attack occurred when the armed men set on a fire a camp resulting in one person killed, while the next day, a group of armed men with machetes and machine guns attacked a similar camp nearby in the Mocímboa da Praia District, killing three.[15][16]
A 28-year-old farmer was shot dead by Naxals who accused him of being a police informer in Rajnandgaon district, in Chhattisgarh.[17]
Taliban militants abducted 60 drivers of coal-supplying trucks in Dara-i-Suf District in Samangan Province. Efforts were underway by security forces to release the abducted drivers.[18]
Militants shelled parts of the Hama Governorate, resulting in a Syrian serviceman dead and another one wounded.[19]
Three Syrian soldiers were killed when Tahrir-al-Sham opened fire and attacked Syrian Army positions in the Khan Tuman village.[20]
The Taliban attacked security outposts in Andkhoy District, killing two police officers and wounding two others. The insurgents captured an outpost and a village in the area.[21]
A person was killed and two others were wounded when a car bomb, planted by suspected Al-Shabaab militants, went off near the parliament in Mogadishu.[22][23]

Multiple assailants on motorcycles opened gunfire on policemen killing one and injuring another one. The attack occurred as the policemen were doing a routine check in Rawalpindi. Hizbul-Ahrar claimed responsibility for the shooting.[24]
31 construction workers were killed in a separatist militant attack in the Nduga Regency in Indonesia.[25][26][27]
A car bomb exploded near a market in Karachi. However, no one was killed or injured due to the car bomb failing to detonate completely.[28][29]
In Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh a protest against illegal cow slaughter erupted into riots resulting in the death of two; a police officer named Subodh Kumar Singh and a protesting youth.[30][31]
A police officer was shot and wounded by the Taliban in Kandahar City. The officer died of his wounds in the hospital next day.[21]

Separatists attacked Cameroonian soldiers guarding a water tank in Kumbo. The next day, soldiers burned dozens of houses in the locality of Romajia. Militants claiming the army have deprived locals from fetching water for over a month due to lack of maintenance. [32]

An improvised bombing detonate in a BancoEstado branch in Las Condes, Santiago de Chile, leaving substantial damage to the infrastructure. At first it was thought to be a failed heist but two anarchist groups claimed responsibility simultaneously perform the attack. The authorities still continue to investigate.[33][34]
Perpetrator: Grupo de Ataque Antipatriarcal Claudia López and N.A.N.G.U

Details: The Taliban stormed a police checkpoint in the Sayyad District, the attack killed 5 policemen including a district chief and also injured 7 people. 13 Taliban were also killed in the attack.[35]

A man was shot dead while waiting for his 13-year-old son outside St Mary's Grammar School in west Belfast. He was shot several times, including in the head, on Glen Road on Tuesday afternoon. Police believe he was shot by a lone gunman wearing a hi-vis vest. At least three suspects were arrested, but were realesed for lack of evidence. Three months later a senior police officer has blamed the Irish National Liberation Army for the assassinations[36][37][38][39]
A tribal leader was gunned down by presumed Islamic State militants after they stormed his house located in the Al-Emrini village of the Nineveh Province.[40]
Anarchist attacked with molotov cocktels the Management of Police Operations - Base of Riot Cop Units (MAT-YMAT) headquarters in Athens. The attack was claimed in an online post.[41]

A Somali journalist in Mogadishu was badly wounded when a bomb concealed in his car blew up as he was nearby. No group has claimed responsibility but Al-Shabaab militants are suspected to be behind[42][43]
Jihadists attacked a gendarmerie by opening fire and wounding 3 gendarmes. 3 vehicles were also set on fire and burnt by the Jihadists in the Seytenga Department.[44][45]

Maoists killed two police informers who were visiting a market in the Bastar District. The police informers were two ex-Maoists who had surrendered earlier and had started to work with the police.[46]
Two members of a pro-government militia were assassinated in Kandahar City by two unknown gunmen riding on a motorcycle. The assailants managed to escape from the area.[21]
The Taliban attacked a police checkpoint in the Herat Province, killing 4 people including 3 civilians and one police officer. 6 Taliban attackers were also killed.[47][48]
The Taliban attacked a security outpost in Shindand District, killing three police officers. The Taliban managed to escape after the attack.[21]
Three rebels were killed and one civilian was injured when militants tried to ambush an army convoy in  in Nagaland’s Mon district.[49][50]
Two police officers were killed and another one was wounded when a roadside bomb detonated in the Zhari District. The blast was blamed on the Taliban.[51]
The owner of a private TV station was kidnapped and his driver was killed by unknown gunmen in Jalalabad City, the provincial capital. An investigation into the incident is underway.[21]
Boko Haram terrorists affiliated with the Islamic State attacked several army bases in the Borno State. The attacks left a soldier dead and a two others wounded.[52][53]
The Islamic State attacked the desert area of Homs resulting in the deaths of 6 Syrian Soldiers and also the deaths of 7 insurgents.[54]
The Islamic State launched an attack on an area close to Abu Kamal, resulting in the 3 deaths of the Syrian Army and several others wounded.[55][56]

Militants shut down two military drones beloging to the Philippine army.The military confirmed the report but did not elaborate on the extent of damage to the drones, besides that the investigations still ongoing. This attack happened close to the start of the campaign period, on Friday for the Bangsamoro plebiscite.[57]
Maoists slit the throat of a mining contractor in the Dantewada District. His vehicle was also set on fire by the Maoists.[58]
Eight soldiers and other ten militants were reported killed during a gunfight in Buni Gari village, Yobe state.[59]
Assailants attacked a gendarmerie in Bankass leaving a soldier killed. The attack, however, was mostly repelled, with 6 gunmen dead and other weapons seized by the army from the gunmen.[60][61]
Four people belonging to the Popular Mobilization Forces were injured when their vehicle was bombed close to the Hilla area.[62]
A deputy sarpanch who was a naxals, was shot dead in the outskirts of his village, near Narayanpur district, Chhattisgarh.[63]

One security officer was killed and three others were injured when an explosive device detonated while they were patrolling in the Kohlu District. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[64]

2018 Chabahar suicide bombing: A suicide car bomb exploded near a police post in Iran's southeastern port city of Chabahar, leaving two police officers dead and 48 other people wounded. The Ansar Al-Furqan group claimed responsibility.[65][66]
A bomb blast struck a military vehicle leaving 7 soldiers dead and two generals killed, several others were wounded. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility.[67]

Two soldiers were killed and several were injuried  when a roadside bomb blast hit their vehicle near the village of Dhanaane, on the coastal road linking the Somali capital to the port city of Marka.[68]

Location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: 17 soldiers and civilians were killed when presumed members of the Allied Democratic Forces attacked villages near Beni with machetes.[69][70]

Terrorists attacked a security patrol, prompting an exchange of fire in which a terrorist was killed and another one was wounded, while two police officers were also injured in the attack that took place in the Dera Ghazi Khan District.[71][72]

NPA insurgents attacked a banana processing plant in Arakan by throwing grenades and prompting a brief gun battle with security forces that resulted in 6 officers injured. The attackers later left.[73][74]

A village near Diafarabe was attacked by gunmen who opened fire, causing the deaths of 5 civilians and a 70-year-old man sent into a coma. The attackers also took away motorcycles and other things.[75]
A commander of a Shiite militia was assassinated by several gunmen in the area of Al-Shuala. The commander had fought against ISIL.[76]
Two policemen were killed in an ambush attack launched by suspected jihadists in the area of Kiembara.[77][78]
A spate of attacks by Boko Haram in the Borno State left 7 people dead including soldiers and civilians, as well as dozens of people injured. Many homes were also burnt in the attacks.[79]
Two soldiers were wounded when an improvised device detonate near a sidewalk, in the rural zone of Hacarí, Norte de Santander Department.[80]
The Taliban attacked army outposts in the Shindand District, leaving 14 Afghan soldiers killed and 21 others captive in the attack.[81][82]
The chief of Dieka-Bafaw, Mbonge was killed in an attack perpetrated by suspected separatist militants.[83]
Six Syrian Soldiers were killed as a result of a mine explosion in the Daraa Governorate.[84]

Members of the EPP attacked a farm in San Vicente Pancholo near General Isidoro Resquín San Pedro Department. The attackers burned three fumigation aircraft, one tractor and one truck beloging to a agro-livestock local company, no injuries were reported.[85]
A roadside bomb struck a civilian vehicle in the Guzara District, killing all 3 occupants that were from the same family. The attack was also blamed on the Taliban.[86][87]

A civilian was killed and two others were injured due to a bomb blast in a car in a village at the Azaz District. No group has claimed responsibility for the bombing yet, but the attack was blamed on YPG.[88][89]

Gunmen opened fire on a security patrol in Rawalpindi, killing a policeman and a civilian while also injuring two others. The act is considered an act of terrorism and Hizbul-Ahrar claimed responsibility.[90][91]
A soldier was killed and three others were wounded in an encounter with presumed insurgents in the Longding district.[92][93]
An Islamic State counterattack against the SDF in Hajin resulted in 44 members of the SDF killed and 56 of the Islamic State killed.[94]

More of twelve students of the University of Bamenda were kidnapped on graduation day. The kidnappers released a video saying that all the students would be released, and that the incident should serve as a warning to other students to uphold the school boycott.[95]
A child was killed and two others were wounded when a landmine left behind by an unspecified terrorist group detonated in a village of the town of Al-Nashabiyah.[96]
Three civilians were injured when their truck carrying merchandise struck a roadside bomb in the Lamu County. Al-Shabaab is suspected to be behind the attack.[97]
Boko Haram launched an attack on a military base in the town of Gulumba located in Bama. The attack caused the death of two soldiers and the injuries of two others.[98][99]
3 militants were killed and 5 policemen were injured in a shootout between security forces and the militants in Srinagar.[100][101]
A bomb blast ripped through a military vehicle in Mogadishu, causing the deaths of 3 soldiers and 2 others wounded. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the bombing.[102]

Location: Hama Governorate, Aleppo and Latakia Governorate, Syria
Details: Militants shelled several provinces of Syria resulting in a Syrian serviceman dead and another one injured.[103]

Location: Farah Province and Faryab Province, Afghanistan
Details: 20 Afghan policemen were killed and 17 others were either captured or wounded in simultaneous attacks by the Taliban in the Farah and Faryab province.[104][105]

A baby was killed and seven people were injured including a pregnant woman in a drive by shooting in the Israeli settlement of Ofra by a Palestinian Nationalist, one of the attackers was shot dead by security forces.[106][107][108]
Gunmen shot dead a Peshmerga fighter in Central Kirkuk. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack but the Islamic State is suspected.[109]
10 security forces were killed and 3 others were wounded in a Taliban attack on a military checkpoint in the Khost Province.[110]

Members of the ELN stopped cargo vehicles at a highway while forcing the drivers to step down. One driver was injured and 5 cargo trucks were set ablaze by the ELN. The driver, die for his injuries in December 12 in a hospital in Rionegro, Antioquia[111][112][113]
Islamic State militants executed six hostages that had been held hostage for almost two months in the Jufra District.[114]

Militants belonging to the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda, attacked the Rubavu district in an assault December 9, killing at least two soldiers while several militants were also killed in the attack.[115][116]
Perpetrator: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda

Details: Two policemen were killed after the Taliban stormed and attacked a checkpoint in Jowzjan's Fayzabad District.[117]
A teacher of the  Government Technical High School was shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Njinikejem, Belo.[118]
At least seven NPA rebels attacked an army  detachment in Barangay Asina, Davao del Sur, no leaving casualties in both sides.[119]
A Taliban attack on a police post in Herat's Pashtun Zarghun District left 6 policemen dead and 10 wounded. 10 Taliban militants were also killed and 8 others were wounded.[120]
Two people belonging to the Iraqi Tribal Mobilization Forces were killed in a roadside bomb blast in  the southeast of Mosul.[121]

Location: Oicha, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: Presumed ADF rebels attacked a village in Oicha, causing the deaths of at least 10 people. The gunmen also looted several houses.[122][123][124]

An improvised explosive device blast bank branch in the commune of Las Condes (centre), no leaving injuries. In the site of the attack left  pamphlets alluding to the death of Sebastián Oversluij, an anarchist militants who was killed five years ago during the assault on a bank. Days later two anarchist groups claimed work together to carry out the attack was directed to the chilean bankers and bourgeoisie.[125][126][127]
Perpetrator: Circulo Iconoclasta Michelle Angiolillo and N.A.N.G.U

Details: The Taliban attacked security checkpoints in Kandahar's Arghistan district, killing 8 policemen while 11 Taliban militants were also killed in the attack.[128]
Four policemen were killed when heavy armed terrorists attacked a police post in the Shopian District. Jaish-e-Mohammed group claimed responsibility for the attack.[129][130][131]

A suicide bombing targeted a security convoy in Kabul's Paghman District, causing 12 deaths, including civilians and security forces, while nine others are injured. The Taliban claimed responsibility for the attack.[132][133]
A roadside bomb blast, planted by suspected Islamic State militants, killed two policemen and wounded four other civilians in the suburbs of a village in the Diyala Province.[134]
The Taliban attacked and stormed security posts in the Baghlan Province, killing 5 police officers.[135]
Unknown gunmen threw a grenade against a police HQ in Tibú, Norte de Santander Department.The attack left only material damage.[136]
At least 42 Tuaregs were killed in a series of attacks by suspected jihadists in the Menaka Region, the attacks consisted of gunmen on motorcycles opening fire on the Tuareg camps.[137][138][139]
The Taliban attacked security posts in the Kunduz Province, killing 10 policemen and injuring 11 others.[140]

2018 Strasbourg attack: Five people were killed and 12 others wounded in a shooting attack near a Christmas Market in Strasbourg. The attacker escaped in a taxi after the attack and was injured during an exchange of gunfire with a soldier on Sentinel patrol. The suspect, Cherif Chekatt, has 27 previous convictions in France, Germany and Switzerland. The prosecutor added the suspect shouted "Allah Akbar" after his shooting spree. Police were able to identify the attacker thanks to a taxi driver who was taken hostage by Chekatt. The suspect told the driver police found a grenade at his place when a search was being conducted the same morning of the attack. Police then linked both cases. Chekatt was also known to domestic intelligence for being radicalized. The attacker was shot dead by French police two days after the attack in Strasbourg, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[141][142][143][144][145]

Two law enforcement officers were injured in a grenade blast in Nazran, the capital of the Russian North Caucasus region of Ingushetia. The two assailants were shot dead in retaliatory fire.[146][147]
The Taliban stormed checkpoints in Badakshan's Jurm District, killing up to seven security personnel and wounding four others.[148]
A car bomb exploded in the city of Azaz killing two people while at least 21 others are injured. The YPG is believed to be behind the attack.[149][150]
Three civilians were killed and at least ten others were injured when a bike bomb exploded in the city of Al-Bab.[151][152]
Al-Shabaab executed in the Lowe Shabelle region three people, including two soldiers.[153]
Armed gunmen believed to be from the Ansar-al-Sunna group attacked a village in the Palma District, killing 6 civilians and burning up to 14 houses.[154][155]
A knife-wielding militant Palestinian was shot dead in Jerusalem's Old City, after lightly injuring two police officers by stabbing.[156]

Armed men seized the residence of Gabsa Nyagha Sixtus, a coordinator of the recently-formed disarmament committee, in Balikumbat. After sending away all civilians, the armed men set the building on fire. Sixtus had been appointed less than a week prior to the attack.[157]
Two Israeli citizens were killed and two others seriously wounded after a shooting at a bus stop in the Jewish settlement of Giv'at Asaf, northern Jerusalem.[158][159]
Two children were killed and another one sustained injuries when a landmine exploded in the South Waziristan district.[160][161]
A motorbike bomb blast in the Syrian city of Afrin, killed four civilians and injured nine others. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[162]
A senior police officer was killed in the Sar-e-Pol province, after being ambushed by the Taliban.[163]
A shootout between soldiers and Abu Sayyaf left a soldier dead and two others wounded; Seven Abu Sayyaf militants were also killed in the shootout that occurred in Patikul Sulu.[164]

Six Pakistani security officers were killed and 14 others were injured when terrorists opened fire and bombed a security convoy in the Kech district.A Balochistan separatist group claimed responsibility for the attack, 4 terrorists were later killed by security forces.[165][166][167][168]
A guided anti-tank missile attack by HTS militants killed over 10 Syrian soldiers and injured several others in southern part of the Aleppo province.[169]
Four civilians and a cop were killed when insurgents opened fire in a funeral ceremony in Balkh's Dawlatabad District. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[170][171]

Jund-al-Khilafah (ISIL) militants carjacked a vehicle and robbed a bank, afterwards they killed a brother of Said Ghozlani (a soldier who was killed by ISIL in 2016). All of the attacks occurred in the province of Kasserine.[172][173][174]
Three civilians were killed and several others were injured when Boko Haram riddled with bullets transport vehicles in a village in the Diffa region.[175][176]

Two civilians were killed and eight other were injured and three buses burned when unknown gunmen attacked.The defence ministry said in a statement that the Saturday evening incident occurred in Cyitabi Sector of Nyamagabe District, near the border with Burundi, and the attackers had fled to nearby Nyungwe Forest. Kagame left open the possibility that the attack may have been mounted by a new group called RNC, one of several other groups which he said had joined forces with FDLR.[177][178]
Perpetrator: Forces Democratiques de la Liberation du Rwanda (suspected)

Details: An attack by Boko Haram terrorists loyal to the Islamic State near the town of Gudumbali, killed 12 soldiers and left dozens of other soldiers missing.[179][180]

A Nigerian military convoy was struck by a roadside bomb near the town of Gamboru, killing 2 soldiers and injuring another soldier. The attack is presumed to have been done by Boko Haram jihadists.[181]
Two gunmen believed to be from the New People's Army, shot dead the wife of a man who belonged to a Citizen Armed Forces Geographical Unit in Talaingod, Davao del Norte.[182]
Two brothers were shot dead by ISIL gunmen in a village at the Syrian town of Thiban.[183]

A rocket struck a house in Gardez, killing three people from the same family including two children and a woman, four others were injured, some locals blamed the police forces for the attack although the police forces blamed the Taliban for the attack.[184]
Three Iraqi policemen were killed when a roadside bomb struck their security patrol in Ramadi.[185]
16 policemen were killed and 6 others were wounded in Taliban attacks in the Province of Kandahar, 12 Taliban were killed and 7 were also wounded in the attacks.[186]

Three Egyptian military officers were killed by militants, when the soldiers tried to carry out the search operations of three civilians who had been kidnapped by the militants in the Central Sinai.[187]

Eight guards were wounded when masked men confronted security guards occupying a repossessed home outside Strokestown, County Roscommon. Additionally six vehicles owned by the security workers parked outside were burned out and a dog killed.[188][189]
Militants believed to be Fulani Herdsmen attacked a village in Jema'a, killing 15 people and injuring at least 24 others. The attack occurred at a wedding ceremony.[190][191]
A policeman was shot dead in Ngoketunjia Division, Ndop, the attack was blamed by separatist.[192]
Two policemen were killed and 8 others were injured, when the Taliban attacked them in the Daykundi Province.[193]

A car bomb exploded near a market in the Syrian city of Afrin, killing 9 people including civilians and rebel fighters and injuring at least 21 others. The Wrath of Olives group claimed responsibility for the attack.[194][195][196][197][198]
The wife of a CAFGU militiaman was shot dead and his husband was injuried when NPA rebelsattacked the house of the couple in Barangay Palma Gil, Talaingod, Davao del Norte on Saturday.[199]
One soldier was killed after the blast of a Landmine Babar Kach Jhalari, SIbi, Balochistan. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.[200]

A bomb exploded in the headquarters of the media station Skai TV. Although there were no casualties, there was extensive damage done to the building. Days later Popular Fighters Group claimed responsibility for the attack and confirmed that the improvised explosive device was made with ammonium dynamite, a signature of the group that has, like other terrorist and anarchist groups .[201][202][203]
Two roadside bombs struck a military convoy, killing 2 police conscripts and injuring 6 others. The attack occurred near the city of Rafah in Egypt.[204][205]
5 Afghan soldiers were killed and 8 others were wounded when the Taliban attacked checkpoints in province of Faryab. 6 Taliban were killed and 12 others were wounded.[206]

Two Congolese soldiers were killed in clashes with Rwandan pro-Hutu rebels after two of their leaders were arrested in an eastern frontier region of the Democratic Republic of Congo. The attack took place after two of their leaders were arrested in an eastern frontier region of the Democratic Republic of Congo[207][208]
Perpetrator: Forces Democratiques de la Liberation du Rwanda

Details: A colombian soldier was killed during a gunfight in San Vincente del Caguan, Caquetá Department.[209]
Boko Haram jihadists attacked a military base near the town of Monguno, killing a soldier and wounding another one.[210][211]

Murders of Louisa Vesterager Jespersen and Maren Ueland: Two female Scandinavian tourists, one Norwegian and one Danish citizen, were found brutally murdered in their tent in the Atlas mountains.[212] The police has arrested a total of 22 Moroccan men in connection with the incident. Islamic State loyalists are suspected behind the attack.[213][214]
Three Iraqi civilians were killed in an attack carried out by Islamic State militants in a village in Western Mosul.[215]
Suspected members of the NPA, ambushed a military vehicle in Catarman, injuring 4 soldiers and 2 civilians in Catarman, Northern Samar.[216]

Terrorists attacked a village in the Macomia District, killing two civilians and burning down 103 houses, it is also believed this is the same group that attacked on Tuesday and beheaded 2 other people in a village nearby.[217]
At least six students and a teacher were kidnapped from three different schools in Bamenda, North West Region.[218]
A Taliban attack on security check posts in the Zabul Province, left 3 Afghan soldiers killed and 8 Taliban also killed.[219]
A roadside bomb struck a minibus, killing 10 civilians and injuring another one in a village at the Benishangul-Gumuz Region, the police blamed the attack on the Oromo Liberation Front.[220][221]

Gunmen believed to be of the Islamic State, attacked a Tuareg camp in the Menaka region, killing 6 Tuaregs and 3 officers, afterwards operations were carried out by the officers in which 10 terrorists were killed.[222][223]

Twelve CAFGU militiamen and two soldiers were kidnapped when NPA rebels broke up in a checkpoint in Sibagat town. In last eight of their hostages in Barangay San Juan, Bayugan, Agusan del Sur. [224][225]
Two IS militants were shot dead after a attempt to attack the security forces in Stavropol district. The militants had planned carry out attacks in the downtown of the city.[226][227]
Armed gunmen attacked a village in the Mocímboa da Praia District, with machetes and guns while also burning down five houses, a civilian was killed and another one was injured in the attack.[228]
Six civilians including four women, were killed and six people were also injured when their vehicle was hit by a roadside bomb planted by suspected jihadists near the village of Boni.[229]
A police commander and his bodyguard were killed in the Dahana i Ghuri District, after there vehicle was hit by a rocket fired from Taliban militants.[230][231]
A rocket attack base of the International Coalition Force at Kandahar Airport, no injuries were reported in the incident.[232]
Two people were killed and another one was wounded when an explosive device went off near market in the Al Mahfad District, among those killed and wounded were members of the Security Belt.[233][234]
Suspected jihadists killed three people including two elected officials in a village in the Oudalan Province. A village president was kidnapped and a resident was shot and wounded.[235]
Six Syrian servicemen were killed and 5 others were wounded in shelling by militants in the Latakia Province.[236]

An arson against three vehicles belonged to the family of Angelos Giannakopoulos were reported. An anarchist group claimed the attack accussing the bussnessman to procuring and human trafficking[237][238]

Armed insurgents attacked a village in the Macomia District, shooting indiscriminately against civilians and setting on fire and burning at least 70 homes. Three civilians were killed and one person was seriously injured while a child and a woman were left missing.[239]
Three farmers were killed in a Boko Haram attack in the village of Gueskerou.[240][241]

A roadside bomb struck a military convoy belonging to Ethiopian troops in the Gedo region. Around 40 soldiers were killed and injured in the bomb attack. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.[242][243]

A child was killed and about 30 people were injured when militants on a motorcycle hurled grenades towards a security center in the town of Shahr in the Hadhramaut Governorate, Al-Qaeda claimed responsibility for the attack.[244][245][246]

Around 26 people were killed and at least 40 others were injured in car bomb attacks near the president's residence and a radio station, in Mogadishu. The attacks were done by Al-Shabaab.[247][248][249][250]
Three soldiers were killed and four others were injured when a bomb struck their vehicle in a highway in the Kompienga Province.[251]
Six security personnel were injured when militants hurled a grenade towards the officers while they were doing a search operation.[252]
A man was shot in a paramilitary-style attack in Cromore Gardens area of the Creggan, Derry. Dissident republicans were suspect for the attack.[253]
A child was killed when Tahrir-al-Sham fired on a vehicle carrying IDPs in the suburbs of Idlib.[254]

Members of the Paraguayan People´s Army shot and killed and his guardhouse burned when the militants attacked a farm in San Vicente Pancholo, a municipality near General Isidoro Resquín, San Pedro Department.[255][256]
Gunmen believed to be of the Islamic State attacked a checkpoint in Khanaqin, killing a policeman and placing a bomb nearby.[257]
Two civilians were injured in an attack perpetrated in La Macarena, Meta, perpetrated by a FARC dissident group, reported sources.[258]
A Cameroonian soldier was shot dead in a separatist militant ambush in the Mbengwi town, Momo Division.[259]

Location: Beni, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Details: Gunmen of the Allied Democratic Forces, attacked a village in the city of Beni, killing 5 people and injuring 3 others. In addition to that, 3 people were also left missing and several goats were stolen by the gunmen.[260][261]

Militants attacked and burned the Italian Institute of Technology.Anarchists have targeted the Institute of Morego for someexperiments with nanothecnology and artificial inteligency, explained in a claim, appeared on the Internet.[262][263]
The Taliban ambushed police officers in the Takhar Province, killing 3 policemen including a senior officer and also injuring 4 others.[264][265]

Two policemen were killed and two others were wounded when multiple gunmen hurled a grenade towards a police a station in the town of Bosaso. No group has claimed responsibility but the Islamic State in Somalia are suspected to be behind the attack.[266]

Three civilians were killed and two were wounded, when the vehicle they were traveling on struck a roadside bomb in the Helmand Province. According to police, the bomb had been placed by the Taliban.[267]

A CAFGU commander and a rebel were killed and three militiamen were injuried during after a 15-minute exchange of fire between government forces and the New People’s Army. who took place in Bangaray Uma, Lubuagan, Kalinga.[268]
Seven civilians were killed in the Dih Yak District, when their minibus had struck a roadside bomb. Officials blamed the bombing on the Taliban.[269][270]
Militants in the Noun Department, killed one person and injured several others. Several people were also kidnapped. Over 60 houses and vehicles were also burnt down by the militants.[271]
One person was killed and many houses were burnt down when Boko Haram attacked a village in Chibok.[272][273]

An arson attack was registered in the city hall. There was no spread, but the fire cleared a lot of smoke and the town hall could not re-open as it was. On the same night, two other suspicious fires took place at La Force, on the other side of Bergerac. A first in front of a technical room belonging to the community of agglomeration of Bergerac and a second in front of the House of the public services. The damage has been limited. Anarchists claimed responsibility for the incident.[274][275]

A suicide bomb and a gun attack on a Kabul government compound killed 43 people and injuring 25 others, 4 attackers are said to have been killed. No group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[276][277][278][279]
A district police chief and three of his bodyguards were killed after a mortar fired by the Taliban, struck a military compound.[280]

A police officer was killed and 5 others were wounded in a bomb attack on a police vehicle in the province of Narathiwat, gunmen opened fire on the vehicle afterwards, insurgents are presumed to be behind the attack.[281][282]

Two members of the Afghan National Civil Order Police (ANCOP) were killed by two of their colleagues in a inner attack in Konjak village of Faizabad District. The two attackers escaped with a Humvee they were traveling in and weapons. A fifth officer escaped.[283]
A Boko Haram ambush close to the town of Damaturu, killed 14 security personnel and injured at least a soldier.[284][285]

An improvised device detonate in front of the Sacred Heart of Jesus Cathedral in the town of Ecatepec, State of México. The attack no left injuries, but caused a mobilization of the authorities in the area. A cell belonging to ITS claimed responsibility for the attack.[286][287]

Two people were killed and 13 others were wounded when a bomb exploded in Baidoa, as the youth were doing celebrations, no group claimed responsibility but Al-Shabaab were suspected after similar attacks in this area in the past.[288]

The Taliban attacked Gorziwan District, killing three police officers. The district police chief, Abdul Samad Gorziwani, suffered severe injuries during the fighting and died of his wounds the next day.[283]

An improvised explosive device was detonated safely by the Batalhão de Operações Policiais Especiais in front of the Santuário Menino Jesus in Brasilia. Police detained a suspect few days later.[289][290][291]

Around 20 civilians were kidnapped by Islamic State militants in Kirkuk, one of the kidnapped civilians managed to escape later while the fate of the rest of the kidnapped civilians remains unknown.[292][293]
A suicide bomber detonated in the city of Kandahar, killing three people and injuring two others, no group has claimed responsibility yet for the attack.[294][295]
A car bomb blast killed two people and injured 11 others in Tal Afar, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the blast.[296][297][298]

Four suicide bombers attacked and stormed Libya's foreign ministry in the capital of Tripoli. Three people and four perpetrators were killed, while ten others were left injured. The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[299][300][301]
Two Afghan soldiers were killed and twelve Taliban militants were killed in attacks on checkpoints in the Faryab Province, two Afghan soldiers were also wounded and three Taliban militants.[302]
Four Kenyan soldiers were injured when an explosive device went off in a military van. Al-Shabaab militants are presumed to be behind the attack.[303][304]

A bomb attack and a subsequent gunfight were reported in a road of Bacho district, Narathiwat Province. At least 20-25 kg of explosives and a large quantity of gunmen armed with M16s were used in the attack, the investigations still ongoing.[305][306]

Four civilians were killed and several civilians were injured when Boko Haram militants in Bolakla, a village some four kilometres to Chibok, in the southern part of Borno State at about 10:00p.m.[307]
Militants attacked and assaulted the 7th Multinational Task Force Brigade of the headquarters of the Multi-national Joint Task Force (MNJTF) in Baga, Borno State.[308]
A local police outpost was attacked and captured by the Taliban in Chimtal District. Three local police were killed and four were wounded.[283]
a civilian was killed during an attack in  Ukemberagya, Gaambe-Tiev community in Logo Local Government Area of Benue State.[309]
At least seven Syrian soldiers were killed and ten others were wounded in an attack by the "Rouse the Believers" group in the Jabal al-Akrad mountains in Syria.[310][311]
A Taliban Red Unit attacked an Afghan army base in Almar District, killing six soldiers and wounding four others.[283]
Eleven soldiers were wounded during an encounter with NPA rebels in Monkayo, the encounter occurred as the officers were investigating IEDs placed by the rebels.[312]

A series of sabotages were reported in the state of Zulia, the venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro, blamed "trained groups " in Colombia for constant blackouts in the border state of Zulia. [313][314]
Two police officers were killed in a Taliban attack in Greshk District.[283]
A roadside mine exploded in Khan Abad District, killing one police officer and wounding three others.[283]

A police officer and a church caretaker was injured after a bomb was detonated outside a Orthodox church of Saint Dionysius the Areopagite in the upscale Kolonaki area, Athens. An eco-terrorist groupl claimed the incident more two weeks later.[315][316]
Armed Chadian militants attacked a military camp of Libyan soldiers near Traghan, killing 7 and injuring 43 others.[317][318]
Boko Haram attacked a military base in the town of Baga, killing 10 people and according to some reports, Boko Haram may have taken over the town.[319][320]

A security patrol was struck by roadside bombs and also an ambush, killing 10 officers and wounding 3 others in the province of Sourou, the Al-Qaeda linked group Jama'at Nasr al-Islam wal Muslimin claimed responsibility for the attack.[321][322][323]
A van crashed into a group of police officers during an antiterrorist control in La Rambla, central Barcelona. Police detained the French driver and suspects a terrorist motive.[324]
Five villagers were shot dead after gunmen attacked  in Rawuru village in the Barkin Ladi district, Plateau State.[325]

Four members of the Syrian Democratic Forces were killed, when an explosive device targeted a four-wheel drive near a court building in the center of Manbij, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.[326][327]
Two people were killed and two others were injured in a bomb explosion in the town of Beledweyne, Al-Shabaab is suspected to be behind the attack.[328]

Three Vietnamese tourists and an Egyptian guide were killed while twelve other people were injured near the pyramids of Giza, when the tour bus carrying them struck a roadside bomb. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack as of yet. Islamist extremists have targeted tourists in the past.[329][330][331]

Two police officers were killed and 5 others were wounded in twin bombings in southern Mosul, three police officers who were recently kidnapped by militants were also found dead in the area nearby.[332]
Four people on motorcycles were injured when a bomb exploded in Narathiwat's Si Sakhon District, insurgents are suspected for the attack.[333]
A grenade was thrown against a bus stand, causing a low intensity blast in the India's Jammu. No casualties were reported.[334]
ISIL gunmen attacked a federal police outpost near Khanaqin, killing two officers and clashes broke out.[335]
Cells of the ISIL organization attacked positions of the Self-Defense Forces in the Al-Omar oilfield, killing 9 people and injuring up to 5 others.[336]
Six Afghan civilians including four women and two children were killed as a result of an IED blast in the Shirin Tagab District, the attack was blamed on the Taliban.[337][338]

Two members of the bomb disposal squad were killed, when they were struck by a bomb in the Mohmand District, another person also suffered injuries, the organization Hizbul Ahrar claimed responsibility.[339][340]

Location: Si Sakhon District and Chanae District, Thailand
Details: Two Homemade attacks were reported in and , four in Chanae district,explosives were "detonated by radio", adding that no one was injured, the authorities said.[341]
The Co-chair of the Legislative Council of Deir-ez-Zor city was gunned down by assailants in the Deir- ez-Zor countryside, ISIL claimed responsibility for the assault.[342][343]
a soldier was captured and decapitated by separatists as the warring parties clashed. No other casualties were reported.[344]
A woman was killed and three soldiers were wounded in shootings and ambush attacks by suspected insurgents in the province of Pattani.[345]
Eight Somali soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab attack in the Bay Region of Somalia, after the terrorists attacked the military base.[346]
A colombian soldier was killed after a gunfight in the rural zone of San Calixto, Norte de Santander Department.[347]

Militants burned four civilian buses and shot dead a civilian in Aurangabad, Maharastra. In other incident naxals burnt a truck near a mine in  Gadchiroli district, Maharastra, but there no casualty, police said[348][349]
Four civilians were killed and three others were wounded in a roadside bomb explosion in the province of Ghazni.[350]

Militants burned down a backhoe of the Costa Araucanía project, and the fact was awarded by a territorial resistance body of the Coordinadora Arauco Malleco "Quilapán ". In the place was found a writing in which demanded the freedom of the Mapuche leader, Facundo Jones Huala., and the attack left three hundred thousand dolars of material damage.[351][352]
A national guard vehicle was ambushed by presumed Katiba Macina assailants in the Koulikoro Area, two soldiers were killed and two others were wounded.[353][354]

Unknown gunmen believed to be ISIL cells attacked with machine guns the town of Al-Tayanna in the Deir-ez-Zor suburbs, killing at least 3 members of the Syrian Democratic forces and also killing a civilian.[355]

A district police chief was killed in Taluqan, when a bomb exploded in a vehicle, three other civilians were wounded in the incident, no group has claimed responsibility but groups like the Taliban has been trying to expand influence in the area.[356][357]
Two people were killed and at least 28 others suffered injuries, when a bomb went off near a mall in the city of Cotabato, the attack was blamed on a pro-ISIL group.[358][359][360]

Police came under fire from militants after the police were sent to investigate the corpse of a person who was beheaded by militants of East Indonesia, the gunfight in the Parigi Moutong Regency resulted in two injuries of the policemen.[361][362]

At least one soldier was injured when militants attacked the Counter-terrorist base of Kepashiato, in Echarate district, La Convención Province in Cusco. The soldier injured its out of danger.[363][364]
An attack launched by Islamic State militants, killed 2 security forces and injured 2 others in the province of Diyala.[365]

An improvised bomb was defused when militants tried to activate. The police coordonate the area and sappers of Carabineros de Chile desactivate the IED. Days later, an anarchist Group claimed responsibility for the incident.[366][367]
A Somali military official was shot and killed by Al-Shabaab gunmen in the Capital of Somalia, Mogadishu.[368]

Three people including one police officer were stabbed in an attack at Victoria Station in Manchester on new years eve. A man was arrested and a witness claims he heard the attacker shout 'Allahu Akbar'. The perpetrator was detained by the police, officers from the counter terrorism are leading the investigation.[369]
